Reviews.Title: Screen and Volume Problems
Reviews.Author: Ed C. Figueroa
Reviews.Content: What an awful product.  Avoid this laptop and HP. My screen died after 6 months.  What is worse?  They want to charge me $390 to repair it.  Customer service is polite but clueless. Obviously based somewhere in India. The laptop never left my office.  Internal crack on the screen by opening the laptop and the warranty does not cover it? The external speakers never worked well either.  Just awful.  HP used to have decent products.  What happened?

Reviews.Title: HP Screens do not last
Reviews.Author: Marc Merriam
Reviews.Content: HP has had some severe problems with their screens and this doesnt seem to be well enough known.  Staples really pushes hp and doesnt even acknowledge this problem but its the real deal.  I have purchsed two different hp laptops about 1 year apart and like clockwork,  first, 1 went after a year and then after about the same ownership period, the other went.these days,  it is not cost effective to have laptops repaired so you end up taking the total loss.asus seems to be the best.

Reviews.Title: We Are Happy Customers
Reviews.Author: jacke97
Reviews.Content: The laptop arrived in a timely fashion.  It came in great condition.  We love the 17.3 inch monitor screen, and even though we were a bit hesitant about Windows 7, we are glad that we made this computer our purchase.

Reviews.Title: HP G71-340US
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Weeks "Ken"
Reviews.Content: This has been a great laptop. It has all the right spec for a desktop replacement or small business machine. I do not have any issues with this laptop. The screen is nice and bright even in the daylight. The Stock build wasnt to heavy with HP software either. It works really well with windows 7. Well worth the buy!!!!

Reviews.Title: The Best Yet!!
Reviews.Author: C. Hall
Reviews.Content: We have purchased several laptop computers and this one is the best one so far. We have had absolutely no problems and we just love it. We give the seller and the product 10 Stars. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: shoddy
Reviews.Author: The Glass Guitar
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for myself and another for my wife. Within a few months the screen frame on hers broke and the battery went bad. I kept mine in one place during that time, but after I started using mine on the battery--for very limited periods--the battery lost all capacity after just a few months. Almost immediately, one of the keys became touchy, not working all the time, and now there are a few keys that don't always work the first time. Both computers will occasionally overheat very quickly and become unusable. My screen is also showing signs of coming loose, and this is a computer that just sits on my desk. Definitely the worst computer I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Better than advertised
Reviews.Author: Jan Gerber "hal ketchum"
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, I purchased this based on a combination of factors, primarily capabilities, speed, capacity and price.  This has been a breeze, set was easy, and performance has been better than I would have expected.  I run Windows Home (purchased seperately), and use it for home and business with no problems to date.  I recommend this to anyone looking for a very good laptop at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Sound volume a bit too low
Reviews.Author: Q. Chen
Reviews.Content: A good desktop-replacement laptop.  Sturdy and heavy.  Seems working just fine.  Wish the sound volume could be a bit higher.  A solution may be to use external speakers.

Reviews.Title: perfect for us!
Reviews.Author: Stacey Gordon "turtle"
Reviews.Content: loved this, was better that we expected!!!  screen size is incredible, perfect my husband that has vision loss.  As for the sound...If you want to watch a movie, get earphones, that is my ONLY complaint!

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: jonhocakes
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks it's been going great. As I write this review I'm watching Netflix in one browser, writing this review in another broser (side by side) and burning a DVD with no delays.Pro's: Size, screen brightness and resolution, HDMI (watch on my TV), keyboard and touchpad, CPU speed and memory are great, options like Lightscribe and Webcam, PriceCon's: No backup discs (you can create images and backups but nothing replaces good old fashioned discs), cases more expensive but duh its a bigger computer,  Speakers are quiet but it is a laptop and I use headphones that have their own volume control so no big deal.I looked at Acer, Dell, and Toshiba. This had great CPU speed, memory, and options for the price (like HDMI and 4 gb memory). So far I'm raving about this PC!

Reviews.Title: let down
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After 2 days of using it and while playing a game, the laptop stopped working, had power but it would not turn on, after calling HP I have to send it in for servicing already.... just 2 days!!

Reviews.Title: Always the best
Reviews.Author: Casper
Reviews.Content: HP laptops are always the best. I have purchased many over the years. Always a sturdy build with beauty. Great customer support when needed. Never a bad product or experience.

Reviews.Title: Great potential, but lots of problems
Reviews.Author: Teka3 "teka3"
Reviews.Content: Design needs improvement, January 19, 2010By  D. D. Umstot "teka3" (Seattle, WA USA) - See all my reviewsI bought this computer thinking it would offer hi-def capability, but it does not. It does offer an HDMI connection which I have not tried. There is no ability to play blu-ray dvds. Thus, it is just a nice wide-screen for playing non hi-def dvds. The wide screen looks nice, but it is more difficult to web surf because of moving the curser all the way across the screen. A standard size screen laptop would be lighter and easier to use if you are not using it to play dvds.Other issues: 1. Shinny black cover shows fingerprints and looks awful unless you constantly wipe it down. 2. Only 3 USB ports means you need a separate USB dock or are constantly plugging and unplugging. 3. Sound built in is very soft--almost inaudible even at max volume--I had to buy external speakers. 4. Everything except sound plugs in at the side, making it very cluttered. Seems some of the sockets could have been placed in the rear. 5. Power plugs in the right side, an inconvenient location. 6. Stainless steel inside makes it difficult to feel mouse pad--everything feels pretty much the same.HP service is also a problem. It has been outsourced to somewhere in South Asia and the people responding do not seem to understand what they are doing. I tried to get a fix on the low sound problem, but after many emails there was no satisfaction--you have to buy external speakers it seems. I also have a different dvd drive than the one specified. The service people could not answer why or what difference the drivers might make in performance.  It took at least 7 emails to find out that this computer cannot do any form of hi-def.I would not have bought this computer if I had known of these shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop
Reviews.Author: Zhengzheng Chen
Reviews.Content: I bought this amazing laptop around one month ago. It really has high performance. Also it 17'' wide screen makes watching movie be a excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: Seems Chintzy
Reviews.Author: Seth Thomas "beemerron"
Reviews.Content: Runs like a graped ape. Not real sure of the SD slot. Got my files to download but module didn't seem to seat too well. AC plug protudes from the right side, contrary to my living arrangement. Why dont they come up with a flush a/c plug. I've had to replace 2 for my Dell. Love the display. My pix look real good. Sound is ok, but it's never loud enough for me, anyway.

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Nom de Plume
Reviews.Content: Bought this machine to replace my 4.5 year-old HP laptop.  Big disappointment!  First, it is overpriced.  Second, the display tends to be on the dark side.  The battery life is a joke--3 hours, max, and that's without watching videos, ripping/burning, gaming, music, etc.  I am not impressed with the speed, either.  My 4.5 year-old HP is just as fast, and gets MUCH better battery life.  In addition, the CD/DVD drive is very flimsy and made of thin plastic.  Looks and feels as if it will break easily.  When I burn a DVD, the drive makes a "chug-chug-chug" sound, like a train.  Ripping music from a CD is slow, too, and again, is faster on my old HP.  As another reviewer mentioned, the AC plug is located on the right side of the computer, which is inconvenient; I prefer it on the left, as do a lot of people, apparently.  The headphone and microphone jacks are located on the front of the machine, instead of the side.  Inconvenient, as well.  Windows 7, which comes pre-loaded, is a dreadful OS, IMO, but that's not HP's fault.  Can't wait to get my old HP fixed--yes, I will invest the money!--and start using it again.  I like HP machines and expected to like this computer, but I'm sorry I bought it.  It's not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop but BLOATED
Reviews.Author: Kevin D. Miller "Kevin Miller"
Reviews.Content: Nice laptop. Performs exceptionally well. Pleanty of horsepower. However, typical HP came loaded with a ton of bloatware.

Reviews.Title: IMPOSSIBLE TO GET REFUND AFTER RETURN
Reviews.Author: Michael Jelic
Reviews.Content: AFTER INADVERTANTLY ORDERING THIS PRODUCT, AMAZON WOULDN'T CANCEL THE ORDER.  WHEN WE RETURNED COMPUTER AMAZON STILL HASN'T REFUNDED THE MONEY - A MONTH LATER!
